title: DYING_S0UL
author: DYING_S0UL
content: I know this is a totally stupid question, but is it possible to send sMerit to myself? I got curious because I was recently messing around checking options, buttons, etc. on my BTT account. After a while, I found a post that I had posted previously. Beside the post, I noticed the +Merit button, which we use to merit others. Out of curiosity, I clicked the button, and it took me to the merit-sending page. I'll attach an image for better understanding. So if anyone knows anything, can you please elaborate?P.S. I haven't tested it yet, so I don't know if it works or not.

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: Why don’t you try and see for yourself?

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: No you can’t it will show u an error message..Check out this thread by Obari you will get more clew and insight of the subject matter   How possible is selfmeriting ?

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: In first place, why would you want to merit your self.that goes against the merit system op and it's not possible except you are thinking of meriting your alt accounts which if you are caught might get you banned or tagged.And I guess you've gotten your answer here mate, I will suggest you lock this thread to avoid repeated reply or abusive comments from other members.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: If you want to send merit to your own post, you will get this error:Why will you send merit to yourself. It is people that will be able to see the quality posts that you have. The newbies and low rank members will abuse it if it is like that. Also that it is telling people not to merit their alt account.It would be good if you can lock this topic now. Go down this thread and you will see lock topic at the lower left side beside move topic.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: You can test it yourself and the merit system has never had that bug.A bug is in early days of merit system, you can send a negative merit to another user. No bug that you can send merit to yourself.Quote from: theymos on January 24, 2018, 11:40:32 PMQuote from: mprep on January 24, 2018, 11:38:29 PMA few leftovers from the bug:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.msg28857781#msg28857781 (negative merit)https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.msg28857729#msg28857729 (zero value merit)https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.msg28857682#msg28857682 (negative merit)It's actually gone, those are just cached.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on August 27, 2023, 09:00:08 AMIn first place, why would you want to merit your self.that goes against the merit system op and it's not possible except you are thinking of meriting your alt accounts which if you are caught might get you banned or tagged.I think you are misinterpreting the forum rules at some point. In the first place, meriting oneself is not possible, so something that is not possible can't break a rule as there will be no rule for something that can't even be done.Meriting one's alt account is merit abuse, for which the abuser might get the punishment of getting their account tagged, but I don't think there is anywhere in the forum rules that states that they will be banned unless I miss those parts, and I will be glad if you can share the link to those and let me correct my path.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: As you can see in the image you posted, you can access the page or the part where you send merits but once you click send you won't be able to merit yourself. Well, you have the answer now and it would be great if you lock this thread. Once again, the answer to your question is, NO. It is not possible to send merits to yourself. You can only send merits to other forum members as .any times as you want as long as you still have smerits.

I am sure he must have tried sending himself over time but couldn't succeed that is why he raised this topic to know others option why he couldn't succeeded sharing to his profile back.
